section.hand:
To my L. T
re
r N
o
6 1591

addressleaf.section:
Belgia 1591 6 Novem
b
To my L. Trea
s

page.lettertext:
May it please yo
r
good L. by letters intercepted, by certaine of
e garrison of
Berghen
up Zoome
, written from
Rome
from
e College of Cardinals, to
e
D. of Parma
e
D. de
Maine,
Montemarciano
General of
e
Popes
army,
Landriano
e Popes
Nuntio,
and to
e Citie of
Paris,
it should appeere
at
e
College was perplexed upon
e Popes deceasse, who died the 15 of Oct
o
lest some alteration should happen to their prejudice in
Fraunce.
Wheru
pon
e next daie after
e death of
e Pope, they dispatched sundrye letters
to
e aforenamed parties, full of encouragement to persist in their courses,
and to trust upon continuance of relief from Rome. I have sent yo
r
L.
e Copie of their letters to Paris, and to
Marsilio Landriano
. The rest to
e D. of Parma, de Maine &c. & because
e differ very littell from those
at
I send, I have left uncopied. Of the Emperors peacemakers,
e last occurrence
at we had, was of their sending to the D. of Parma, for
3 Cornets of horse to conduct them to
Brussels.
I have moved
Count
Maurice,
who is greatly opposite to
at Treaty, to cause some companies
of horse of that garrison in Berghen and
Breda,
to lie in waite for their
comming, and under pretext of seeking
e Enemye, to finde those Ambassado
rs
.
The Count hath not only promised to doe it, but hath given order already
for 700 horse to be imploied to that purpose. Howbeit it is a matter
concealed from the
Councel of State
, for
at he thinkes among many, it
may be ether discovered, or through doubtes and delaies, be cleane broken of.
Hage 6 N
o
1591.
